intro: Dianthus multipunctatus var. velutinus, commonly known as the velvet pinks, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries. The flowers bloom in spring and early summer, adding a vibrant touch to the landscape.
